questions.question: The primary stage of production is concerned with

choices.answer: growing crops and extracting the earth's natural resources
providing services to consumers and industry
converting raw materials into finished goods
transporting goods to the final consumer

questions.question: The tertiary sector of industry is the most important sector in high income countries because

choices.answer: agricultural output is more important than services
they use most of their income to buy manufactured goods
workers are employed in manufacturing in these countries
consumers' incomes are high so they spend more on services

questions.question: Which following businesses would you classify as being in the secondary sector of industry?

choices.answer: An oil exploration company
A family run farm business
A taxi operating business
A shoe manufacturer

questions.question: In a mixed economy which of these industries is most likely to be controlled by the government?

choices.answer: Hotels and restaurants
Health and public transport
Building and taxi services
Food shops and farming

questions.question: Which of the following is the best definition of privatisation?

choices.answer: When private limited companies convert into public companies
When a partnership converts into a private limited company
When a state owned industry is sold to the private sector
When a private sector firm is purchased by the government

questions.question: Which one of the following is a disadvantage of privatisation?

choices.answer: Jobs might be lost as private owners try to cut costs
The government raises money which could help to reduce taxes
Less competition than when the industry was a monopoly
Politicians will now influence business decisions

questions.question: Changes in importance of different sectors of industry in a country is likely to be caused by

choices.answer: the exhaustion of the country's copper mines
an increase in the country's population
a long period of no increases in family incomes
government grants available to businesses in all sectors
